result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:13p.m.
Clerk Micki
INCLUDES 22CF45 and 22CF536
 
State appears by ADA Hannah Boeck; Defendant appears in person with Attorney Jeffery Joy appearing via Zoom video;

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

State moves to:
22CF45
COUNT 2: Bail Jumping - Felony >> DRI.
COUNT 3: Bail Jumping - Felony >> DRI.

22CF536
COUNT 1: Bail Jumping - Felony >> DRI.

COURT GRANTS.

PLEA to: 
22CF45
COUNT 1: Bail Jumping - Felony >> GUILTY.

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 1 year probation; CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent; AODA and f/u; Maintain FTW; Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances, unless prescribed and to only be taken as prescribed; DNA sample and surcharge; and CC. Defense has 10 days to provide jail credit stipulation to the State. No objection to transferring probation to county of residence:  Forest County.

ADJ: 2:34 p.m.
Plea hearing on July 28, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

Includes 22CF45, 22CF536
State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence; Defendant appears in person w/Attorney Jeffery Joy by phone
DATES:

Clerk:  Micki.
Case Called: 
INCLUDES 22CF45 and 22CF536

State appears by ADA Hannah Boeck.
Defendant appears in person; with Attorney Jeffery Joy appears via Zoom.
D.B. appears in person.

Date and time set for a JPTC/TPD.  Also adressing non-waivable no contact. 

ADA Boeck recites history of files.  Has not sent a settlement offer.
COURT addresses Atty Joy.
Atty Joy makes statement regarding cases. 
Parties calendar.

ADA Boeck makes statement regarding non-waivable no contact.  Bond Modification - not prepared to proceed as no motion has been filed.
Atty Joy makes statement regarding motion.
COURT addresses non-waivable no contact.
D.B. makes statement regarding non-waivable no contact. 

COURT advises Atty Joy to file bond modification.

DATES:
CC: 6/2/22 at 8:05a.m. (Defendant is excused)
PTC: 6/14/22 at 10:15a.m.

ADJ: 10:30a.m.

No contact with victim(s): DB; Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.
